Then [he]1173-morpheus bends over [her]4646-my poor wife pillow , with tears streaming down [his]1173-morpheus face , and says : ‘[525-juno] [[My]0-i poor wife]4646-my poor wife , do [you]4646-my poor wife know [[your]4646-my poor wife [Ceyx]1162-ceyx]4647-your ceyx , or has [my]0-i face altered in death ? Look at [me]0-i : [you]4646-my poor wife will recognise [me]0-i , and find for [a husband]3428-a husband , [a husband]3428-a husband ’s shade ! [Your]4646-my poor wife prayers have brought [me]0-i no help , [Alcyone]955-alcyone ! [I]0-i am dead ! Do not hold out false hopes of [my]0-i return ! [Storm - laden Auster]4650-storm - laden auster , the south wind , caught [the ship]2497-the ship in [Aegean waters]4652-aegean waters , and tossed in tempestuous blasts , wrecked [her]2497-the ship there . [My]0-i lips , calling helplessly on [your]4646-my poor wife name , drank the waves . [No dubious author]4653-no dubious author announces this news to [you]4646-my poor wife , nor do [you]4646-my poor wife hear it as a vague report : [I]0-i [myself]0-i , drowned , as [you]4646-my poor wife see [me]0-i before [you]4646-my poor wife , tell [my]0-i fate . Get up , act , shed tears , wear mourning : do not let [me]0-i go down unwept to [[Tartarus]7-tartarus ’s void]4654-tartarus ’s void . ’ [Morpheus]1173-morpheus spoke these words in a voice [she]4646-my poor wife would believe to be [[her]4646-my poor wife husband]5872-her husband ’s ( the tears that [he]5872-her husband wept also seemed real tears ) and [his]5872-her husband hands revealed [Ceyx]1162-ceyx ’s gestures . [Alcyone]955-alcyone groaned , tearfully , stirring [her]955-alcyone arms in sleep , and seeking [his]5872-her husband body , grasped only air , and cried out : ‘[4646-my poor wife] Wait for [me]0-i ! Where do [you]4655-you vanish ? [We]4656-we will go together . ’ Roused by [her]955-alcyone own voice , and [[her]955-alcyone husband]5872-her husband ’s image , [she]955-alcyone started up out of sleep . First [she]955-alcyone gazed round to see if [he]5872-her husband was still there , the one [she]955-alcyone had just seen . At the sound of [her]955-alcyone cry [the servants]8074-the servants had brought a lamp . Not finding [him]5872-her husband anywhere , [she]955-alcyone struck [her]955-alcyone face with [her]955-alcyone hands , tore [her]955-alcyone clothes from [her]955-alcyone breasts , and beat at the breasts themselves . [She]955-alcyone did not wait to loosen [her]955-alcyone hair , but tore at it , and shouted at [[her]955-alcyone nurse]3142-her nurse , who asked the cause of [her]955-alcyone grief : ‘[955-alcyone] [Alcyone]955-alcyone is nothing , is nothing : [she]955-alcyone has died together with [[her]955-alcyone Ceyx]4657-her ceyx . Be done with soothing words ! [He]4657-her ceyx is wrecked : [I]0-i saw [him]4657-her ceyx , [I]0-i knew [him]4657-her ceyx , [I]0-i stretched out [my]0-i hands towards [him]4657-her ceyx as [he]4657-her ceyx vanished , eager to hold [him]4657-her ceyx back . It was a shadow , yet it was [[my]0-i husband]6062-my husband ’s true shadow , made manifest . True , [he]4657-her ceyx did not have [his]4657-her ceyx accustomed features , if [you]4659-she ask [me]0-i , nor did [his]4657-her ceyx face shine as before . But pallid and naked , with dripping hair , [I]0-i , [the unfortunate one]4660-the unfortunate one , saw [him]4657-her ceyx . Look , [[my]0-i poor husband]4661-my poor husband stood on that very spot , ’ and [she]4660-the unfortunate one tried to find a trace of [his]4657-her ceyx footprints . ‘[4661-my poor husband] This is what [I]0-i feared , with [my]0-i divining mind , this : and [I]0-i begged [you]4659-she not to leave [me]0-i , chasing the winds . But , for certain , [I]0-i should have desired [you]4659-she to take [me]0-i with [you]4659-she , since [you]4659-she were going to [your]4659-she death . How good it would have been to have gone with [you]4659-she : then no part of [my]0-i life would have lacked [your]4659-she presence , nor would [we]4662-we be separated by death . Now [I]0-i have died absent from [myself]0-i , and am thrown through the waves , absently , and [the sea]1464-the sea takes [me]0-i , without [me]0-i . [My]0-i mind would treat [me]0-i more cruelly than [the sea]1464-the sea , if [I]0-i should try to live on , and fight to overcome [my]0-i sorrow ! But [I]0-i shall not fight , nor leave [you]4659-she , [[my]0-i poor husband]4661-my poor husband , and at least now [I]0-i shall come as [[your]4659-she companion]6147-your companion . If not [the sepulchral urn the lettered stone]4667-the sepulchral urn the lettered stone will join [us]4662-we : if [I]0-i shall not touch [you]4659-she , bone to [my]0-i bone , still [I]0-i will touch [you]4659-she , name to name . ’ Grief choked further words , and lamentation took their place wholly , and sighs drawn from a stricken heart . Morning had broken . [She]4659-she went out of [the house]1713-the house towards [the shore]2065-the shore , sadly seeking the place where [she]4659-she had watched [him]4661-my poor husband depart . And while [she]4659-she stayed there , and while [she]4659-she was saying : ‘[0-i] Here [he]4661-my poor husband loosed the rope , on this strand [he]4661-my poor husband kissed [me]0-i as [he]4661-my poor husband left , ’ and while [she]4659-she recalled the significant actions by [their]8078-their locations , and looked seawards , [she]4659-she saw in the flowing waves what looked like a body , unsure at first what it was : after the tide had brought it a little nearer , though it was some way off , it was clearly a body . [She]4659-she did not know whose it was , but was moved by the omen of [this shipwrecked man]8079-this shipwrecked man , and as if [she]4659-she wept for [the unknown dead]8080-the unknown dead , [she]4659-she cried out : ‘[4661-my poor husband] Alas for [you]4661-my poor husband , poor soul , whoever [you]4661-my poor husband may be , and [[your]4661-my poor husband wife]4668-your wife , if [you]4661-my poor husband have [one]5944-one ! ’ The body had been washed nearer by [the sea]1464-the sea , and the more [she]4659-she gazed at it , the smaller and smaller shrank [her]4659-she courage : woe ! Now it was close to [land]1458-land , now [she]4659-she could see who it was : it was [[her]4659-she husband]5872-her husband ! [She]4659-she cried out : ‘[4670-him] It ’s [him]4670-him ! ’ and together tearing at cheeks , and hair , and clothes [she]4659-she stretched out [her]4659-she trembling hands to [Ceyx]1162-ceyx , saying : ‘[4670-him] O , is it like this , [dear husband]3948-dear husband , is it like this , wretched one , [you]3948-dear husband return to [me]0-i ? ’ A breakwater built by the waves , broke the initial force of [the sea]1464-the sea , and weakened the onrush of the tide . Though it was amazing that [she]4659-she could do so , [she]4659-she leapt onto it : [she]4659-she flew , and , beating the soft air on new - found wings , a sorrowing bird , [she]4659-she skimmed the surface of the waves . As [she]4659-she flew , [her]4659-she plaintive voice came from a slender beak , like [someone grieving and full of sorrows]8085-someone grieving and full of sorrows . When [she]4659-she reached [the mute and bloodless corpse]8086-the mute and bloodless corpse , [she]4659-she clasped the dear limbs with [her]4659-she new wings and kissed the cold lips in vain with [her]4659-she hard beak . [People]1519-people doubted whether [Ceyx]1162-ceyx felt this , or merely seemed to raise [his]1162-ceyx face by a movement of the waves , but [he]1162-ceyx did feel it : and at last through [the gods]1538-the gods ’[4670-him] pity , both were changed to birds , [the halcyons]4672-the halcyons . Though [they]4673-their suffered the same fate , [their]4673-their love remained as well : and [their]4673-their bonds were not weakened , by [their]4673-their feathered form . [They]4673-their mate and rear [[their]4673-their young]4674-their young , and [Alcyone]955-alcyone broods on [her]955-alcyone nest , for seven calm days in the wintertime , floating on [the water]1620-the water ’s surface . Then the waves are stilled : [Aeolus]511-aeolus imprisons the winds and forbids [their]4676-their roaming , and controls [[his]511-aeolus grandsons]4677-his grandsons ’ waves . Seeing these birds flying together over [the wide sea]8089-the wide sea , [some old man]8090-some old man praised those affections maintained till the end . [Someone near by]8091-someone near by , or [the same man]8092-the same man ( pointing to a long - necked diving bird ) said : ‘[511-aeolus] That bird also , skimming over [the ocean]1657-the ocean , trailing [his]511-aeolus slender legs , is [a descendant of [kings]1975-kings]4679-a descendant of kings . If [you]4681-you want to trace [his]511-aeolus ancestry in unbroken line to [himself]511-aeolus , its source was [Ilus the younger]1178-ilus the younger , [the son of [Tros]1179-tros]4682-the son of tros , and [[his]511-aeolus brothers]2253-his brothers [Assaracus]1180-assaracus , and [Ganymede]1129-phrygian ganymede , whom [Jove]605-jove snatched , [[Ilus]1178-ilus the younger ’s son]4684-ilus ’s son , [old Laomedon]878-laomedon , and [[his]511-aeolus son]1773-his son [Priam]1181-priam , whom fate assigned to [Troy]271-troy ’s last days . That bird was [[Hector]605-jove ’s brother]4686-hector ’s brother , [Aesacus]1182-aesacus , who , if [he]4686-hector ’s brother had not met [his]4686-hector ’s brother strange fate in youth , would perhaps have had no less a name than [Hector]605-jove , though [Hecuba]1183-hecuba , [daughter of [Dymas]1184-dymas]4687-daughter of dymas , bore [Priam]1181-priam the first , the other [Aesacus]1182-aesacus , is said to have been born to [Alexirrhoë]1185-alexirrhoë , [daughter of two - horned Granicus]4688-daughter of two - horned granicus , [the river - god]2896-the river - god , in secret , under the shadow of [Mount Ida]577-mount ida . [He]1182-aesacus hated [cities]6123-cities , and lived in [the remote mountains]4691-the remote mountains , and insignificant country places , far away from [the glittering court]4692-the glittering court , and rarely visited crowded [Ilium]339-ilium . Yet [he]1182-aesacus did not have an uncultured heart , or one averse to love , and [he]1182-aesacus often pursued [Hesperie]340-hesperie , [the River [Cebren ’s daughter]4694-cebren ’s daughter , through all the woodland glades , whom [he]1182-aesacus had caught sight of , drying [her]340-hesperie flowing hair , in the sun , on [[her]340-hesperie father]1694-her father ’s shore]4693-the river cebren ’s daughter , through all the woodland glades , whom he had caught sight of , drying her flowing hair , in the sun , on her father ’s shore . [The nymph]1783-the nymph fled on sight , as a frightened hind flees the tawny wolf , or a wild duck , caught far from [the pool [she]1783-the nymph left]4697-the pool she left , the hawk . But [the Trojan hero , driven by swift love]4698-the trojan hero , driven by swift love , followed [her]1783-the nymph , driven by swift fear . [Behold]1186-behold , a serpent , hidden in the grass , bit [her]1783-the nymph foot with [his]1182-aesacus curving fang , as [she]1783-the nymph fled by , and left [his]1182-aesacus poison in [her]1783-the nymph body . [Her]1783-the nymph flight ended with [her]1783-the nymph life . [The lover]2082-the lover clasped [her]1783-the nymph unbreathing body and cried : ‘ [I]2082-the lover regret , [I]2082-the lover regret [I]2082-the lover followed [you]1783-the nymph ! But [I]2082-the lover did not expect this , and it was not worth this to attempt to win [you]1783-the nymph . [We]8093-we two have destroyed [you]1783-the nymph , [poor girl]8094-poor girl : the wound given by a snake , the cause of it all [myself]2082-the lover ! Let [me]2082-the lover be [the more accursed]8095-the more accursed , if [I]2082-the lover do not send [you]1783-the nymph solace by [my]2082-the lover death . ’[2082-the lover] [He]2082-the lover spoke , and threw [himself]2082-the lover from a cliff , eroded below by the rough waves , into [the sea]1464-the sea . [Tethys]562-tethys , pitying [him]2082-the lover , caught [him]2082-the lover gently as [he]2082-the lover fell , clothed [him]2082-the lover with feathers as [he]2082-the lover floated on the water , and denied [him]2082-the lover the opportunity to choose [his]2082-the lover death . [The lover]2082-the lover was angered , that [he]2082-the lover was forced to live , against [his]2082-the lover will , and that [his]2082-the lover spirit was thwarted , wishing to leave its unhappy residence . When [he]2082-the lover had gained the new wings on [his]2082-the lover shoulders , [he]2082-the lover flew up and threw [his]2082-the lover body again into [the sea]1464-the sea . [His]2082-the lover feathers broke [his]2082-the lover fall . In a rage , [Aesacus]1182-aesacus dived headlong into [the deep]1919-the deep and tried endlessly to find a path to death . [His]1182-aesacus love made [him]1182-aesacus lean : [his]1182-aesacus legs are long between the joints : [his]1182-aesacus neck remained long : [his]1182-aesacus head is far from [his]1182-aesacus body . [He]1182-aesacus loves seawater , and from diving there [he]1182-aesacus takes [his]1182-aesacus name , mergus , [the diver]4704-the diver . [The father]1852-the father , [Priam]1181-priam , mourned for [the son]4706-the son , [Aesacus]1182-aesacus , not knowing that [he]4706-the son was still alive in winged form . [Hector]605-jove with [[his]605-jove brothers]2253-his brothers had also , inappropriately , offered sacrifices at a tomb inscribed with [his]605-jove name . [Paris]1187-paris was not present at this sad ritual , [he]605-jove , who presently brought extended war on [[his]605-jove country]6809-his country because of [the wife [he]605-jove had stolen]4709-the wife he had stolen . [The whole Pelasgian race]4710-the whole pelasgian race , joined together to pursue [him]605-jove , in [a thousand ships]4711-a thousand ships , and vengeance would not have been long in coming had not fierce winds made [the seas]2725-the seas un - navigable , and [the land of [Boeotia]62-boeotia]4713-the land of boeotia detained [the waiting ships in [the fishing - grounds of [Aulis]341-aulis]4715-the fishing - grounds of aulis]4714-the waiting ships in the fishing - grounds of aulis . After [they]4716-they had prepared a sacrifice to [Jupiter]1158-jupiter [there]1878-there , after the customs of [[their]4716-they country]4718-their country , and when the ancient altar was alive with the kindled flames , [the Greeks]1188-greeks saw a dark - green snake sliding into a plane tree that stood near to where [they]4716-they had begun the sacrifice . There was a nest with eight young birds in the crown of the tree , and these the serpent seized and swallowed in its eager jaws , together with the mother bird who circled [her]4719-her doomed fledglings . [They]4716-they looked at it wonderingly , but [Calchas]1189-calchas , [the seer]2424-the seer , [son of Thestor]4721-son of thestor , interpreted the truth , saying : ‘ [We]4716-they will conquer , [Greeks]1188-greeks , rejoice ! [Troy]271-troy will fall , though [our]4716-they efforts will be of long duration , ’[4721-son of thestor] and [he]4721-son of thestor divined nine years of war from the nine birds . The snake was turned to stone , exactly as it was , twined around the green branches , and stamped in the stone its serpent shape . [Boreas]497-boreas , the north - wind , continued to stir the waves violently , and would not grant [the warships]4722-the warships a crossing , and some thought [Neptune]514-neptune was sparing [Troy]271-troy , because [he]514-neptune had built [its]271-troy walls . But not [Calchas]1189-calchas . [He]4721-son of thestor knew and did not withhold from [them]4716-they , that [a virgin]5906-a virgin ’s blood would appease the wrath of [Diana]527-diana , [the virgin goddess]2072-the virgin goddess . When consideration of the common cause had conquered affection , and [the king]6572-the king had suppressed [the father]1852-the father , and as [Iphigenia]1190-iphigenia stood , among [[her]1190-iphigenia weeping attendants]4727-her weeping attendants , before the altar , to surrender [her]1190-iphigenia innocent blood , [the goddess]5864-the goddess was vanquished , and veiled [their]4716-they eyes in mist , and , in the midst of the rites and confusion of the sacrifice , and the cries of the suppliants , [they]4716-they say [she]5864-the goddess substituted a hind for [the Mycenean girl]4729-the mycenean girl . When , therefore , [Diana]527-diana had been appeased , by [the required victim]4730-the required victim , and [the sea]1464-the sea ’s anger had subsided simultaneously with that of [Phoebe]524-phoebe , [the thousand ships]4732-the thousand ships , driven by a tail wind , reached [the shores of [Phrygia]176-phrygia]4733-the shores of phrygia , after many adventures . There is a place at [the centre of [the World]1448-the world]7845-the centre of the world , between [the zones of earth]4736-the zones of earth , [sea , and sky]4737-sea , and sky , at [the boundary of [the three worlds]4739-the three worlds]4738-the boundary of the three worlds . From here , whatever exists is seen , however far away , and every voice reaches listening ears . [Rumour]1191-rumour lives there , choosing [a house for [herself]1191-rumour on [a high mountain summit]4741-a high mountain summit]4740-a house for herself on a high mountain summit , adding innumerable entrances , a thousand openings , and no doors to bar the threshold . It is open night and day : and is all of sounding bronze . All rustles with noise , echoes voices , and repeats what is heard . There is no peace within : no silence anywhere . Yet there is no clamour , only the subdued murmur of voices , like the waves of [the sea]1464-the sea , if [you]4743-you hear them far off , or like the sound of distant thunder when [Jupiter]1158-jupiter makes the dark clouds rumble . Crowds fill [the hallways]4744-the hallways : [a fickle populace]4745-a fickle populace comes and goes , and , mingling truth randomly with fiction , a thousand rumours wander , and confused words circulate . Of these , some fill idle ears with chatter , others carry tales , and [the author]4746-the author adds something new to what is heard . Here is Credulity : here is rash Error , empty Delight , and alarming Fear , sudden Sedition , and Murmurings of doubtful origin . [Rumour]1191-rumour [herself]1191-rumour sees everything that happens in [the heavens]1940-the heavens , throughout [the ocean]1657-the ocean , and on [land]1458-land , and inquires about everything on [earth]1449-earth . [She]4746-the author had spread the news that [the Greek fleet]4751-the greek fleet was nearing , filled with [brave warriors]4752-brave warriors , and so the arrival of [the armed host]4753-the armed host was no surprise . [The Trojans]4754-the trojans opposed the landing , and defended [[their]4754-the trojans coast]4755-their coast . [You]4743-you , [Protesilaüs]1192-protesilaüs , were the first to fall beneath [Hector]605-jove ’s deadly spear , and joining in battle cost [the Greeks]4756-the greeks dearly , and [they]4756-the greeks knew mighty [Hector]605-jove ’s spirit by the slaughter . [The Phrygians]1193-the phrygians learnt at no small expense of blood , the power of an Achaian hand . Now [the Sigean shores]342-the sigean shores ran red : now [Cycnus]598-cycnus , [a son of [Neptune]514-neptune]4757-a son of neptune , had consigned [a thousand men]4758-a thousand men to death : now [Achilles]1161-achilles pursued in [[his]1161-achilles chariot]6713-his chariot , and laid whole columns of [men]5788-men low with a blow of [his]1161-achilles spear from [Pelion]504-pelion . Searching the battlelines for [Cycnus]598-cycnus or for [Hector]605-jove , [he]1161-achilles came upon [Cycnus]598-cycnus ( [His]1161-achilles meeting with [Hector]605-jove postponed till the tenth year of the war ) . Then [Achilles]1161-achilles , urging on [his]1161-achilles horses , [their]4761-their snowy necks straining against the harness , [he]1161-achilles drove [[his]1161-achilles chariot]6713-his chariot straight at [the enemy]6372-the enemy , striking out , with the quivering spear , with all [his]1161-achilles strength , saying : ‘ [O youth]8096-o youth , whoever [you]8096-o youth may be , take death ’s comfort in being killed by [[Achilles]1161-achilles of [Haemonia]25-haemonia]8097-achilles of haemonia ! ’[1161-achilles] So [Aeacides]986-the aeacides spoke : [His]1161-achilles heavy spear followed the words , but although there was certainly no error in the flight of the spear , still the sharp point of the flying blade had no effect , and only bruised [Cycnus]598-cycnus ’s chest , like a blunted weapon . ‘ [O son of [the goddess]5864-the goddess]8098-o son of the goddess , ’[598-cycnus] [Cycnus]598-cycnus said , ‘ fame has made [you]598-cycnus known to [me]4764-he , why are [you]598-cycnus amazed [I]4764-he have no wound ? ( [He]4764-he was indeed amazed ) Neither this helmet [you]598-cycnus see , with its yellow horsehair crest , nor the hollow shield weighing down [my]4764-he left arm , is to protect [me]4764-he : they only look to serve as ornament . [Mars]635-mars too wears [his]635-mars armour for this reason ! Take away the use of this protective covering : [I]4764-he will still escape unharmed . It is worth something to be [the son]4706-the son , not of [[Nereus]505-nereus ’s daughter]8101-nereus ’s daughter , but of [[him]505-nereus who rules [Nereus]505-nereus and [[his]505-nereus daughters]6859-his daughters]8102-him who rules nereus and his daughters , and [the whole ocean]4032-the whole ocean as well . ’[4764-he] [He]4764-he spoke , and hurled [his]4764-he spear at [Achilles]1161-achilles , but it stuck fast in [his]1161-achilles round bronze shield . It tore through the bronze and nine layers of bull ’s hide , but was stopped by a tenth . Shaking it off , [the Greek hero]4765-the greek hero once more threw a quivering spear from [his]4765-the greek hero mighty hand . Again [[his]4765-the greek hero enemy]6576-his enemy ’s body was whole and unharmed . A third spear could not even graze [Cycnus]598-cycnus though [he]598-cycnus laid [himself]598-cycnus open to it . [Achilles]1161-achilles flared up , like a bull in [the arena]4767-the arena , when it charges with its deadly horns at the Carthaginian cloak , and finds it escapes damage . [He]4764-he examined the spear to see if the iron point had been loosened : it was fixed to the shaft . ‘ Is [my]4764-he hand enfeebled , ’[4764-he] [he]4764-he said , ‘ so that the power it had is lacking against [this man]2515-this man ? ’[4764-he] Certainly it was strong enough when [I]0-i led the overthrow of [[Lyrnessus]343-lyrnessus ’s walls]4768-lyrnessus ’s walls , or when [I]0-i drenched [the island of [Tenedos]24-tenedos]4769-the island of tenedos , and [[Mysian]4770-mysian Thebes]4771-mysian thebes , [[Eetion]1194-eetion ’s city]4772-eetion ’s city , in [their]4773-their own blood , when [the River Caïcus]344-the river caïcus ran red with the slaughter of those around [it]344-the river caïcus , and [Telephus]1195-telephus twice felt the touch of [my]0-i spear . Here also , [my]0-i right hand has prevailed , and will prevail , striking so many , the heaps of corpses [I]0-i made and see on [the shore]2065-the shore . ’ [He]0-i spoke , and as if not believing the results of [his]0-i previous actions , [he]0-i threw the spear straight at [Menoetes]1196-menoetes , [one of [the Lycian men]8107-the lycian men]8106-one of the lycian men , simultaneously piercing [his]1196-menoetes breastplate and the breast beneath . As [the dying man]8108-the dying man beat [his]1196-menoetes head against the solid earth , [Achilles]1161-achilles pulled the spear from the hot wound , and cried : ‘[4776-their] This is the hand , and this is the spear with which [I]0-i have just been victorious : [I]0-i shall use it on [this enemy]4775-this enemy , and [I]0-i pray [his]4775-this enemy end may be the same . ’ Thus [he]1161-achilles pursued the death of [Cycnus]598-cycnus again , and the ashen shaft did not err , thudding unavoidably into the left shoulder , from which it recoiled as if from a wall or a solid rock . [Achilles]1161-achilles saw that [Cycnus]598-cycnus was stained with blood where it struck , and exulted , but in vain : there was no wound : it was [Menoetes]1196-menoetes ’s blood ! Then truly maddened , [he]1161-achilles leapt headlong from [his]1161-achilles high chariot , and seeking out [[his]1161-achilles charmed enemy]8109-his charmed enemy , at close quarters , with glittering sword , saw shield and helmet carved through , but still the iron blunted on the impenetrable body . [He]1161-achilles could stand it no longer , and [he]1161-achilles beat at the face and hollow temples of [[his]1161-achilles enemy]6576-his enemy three or four times with [his]1161-achilles raised shield and sword - hilt . One presses as the other gives way : [he]1161-achilles rushes and harries [him]6576-his enemy , allowing no respite from the shock . Fear grips [Cycnus]598-cycnus , shadows swim in front of [his]598-cycnus eyes , and , as [he]598-cycnus steps backwards , [his]598-cycnus retreating step is blocked , by a boulder , on the open ground . As [he]598-cycnus is trapped with [his]598-cycnus body bent against it , [Achilles]1161-achilles turns [him]598-cycnus over with great force , and dashes [him]598-cycnus to the ground . Then pressing [his]1161-achilles hard knees and shield into [Cycnus]598-cycnus ’s chest , [he]1161-achilles pulls on the helmet straps , which , tightening under the chin , squeeze the throat and windpipe , and stop the passage of breath . [He]1161-achilles prepares to strip [[his]1161-achilles defeated enemy]8111-his defeated enemy : [he]1161-achilles sees empty armour : [the god of [the sea]1464-the sea]8112-the god of the sea has changed the body into that of a white bird , whose name is the one [he]1161-achilles bore , but a moment ago . This battle brought about that truce , of many days duration , when [both sides]8114-both sides grounded [their]8114-both sides weapons and rested . While [alert sentries]8115-alert sentries patrolled the Trojan walls and [alert sentries]8115-alert sentries patrolled [the Greek trenches]8117-the greek trenches , a feast day arrived , on which [Achilles]1161-achilles , [the victor over [Cycnus]598-cycnus]8118-the victor over cycnus , was propitiating [Pallas]1098-pallas with the blood of a sacrificial cow . When its entrails had been placed on the blazing altars , and the perfume [the gods love]8119-the gods love had climbed to the heavens , part was put aside for [their]8119-the gods love holy rites , and the rest set out on the tables . [The leaders]8120-the leaders reclined on couches , and ate [their]8120-the leaders fill of the roasted meat , while [they]8120-the leaders quenched [their]8120-the leaders thirst , and drowned [their]8120-the leaders cares , with wine . The zither , the sound of singing , the long boxwood flute pierced with many holes , was not [their]8119-the gods love entertainment , rather [they]8119-the gods love lengthened the night with talk , and courage was [their]8119-the gods love theme . [They]8119-the gods love talked of [[their]8119-the gods love enemies]8121-their enemies ’[4776-their] battles , and of [their]4776-their own , and delighted in recounting , in turn , the dangers [they]4776-their had encountered and survived . What else should [Achilles]1161-achilles speak of , and what else should be spoken of in great [Achilles]1161-achilles ’s presence ? The foremost talk was of [his]1161-achilles latest victory , the overthrow of [Cycnus]598-cycnus . It seemed wondrous to all of [them]4777-them that [a warrior]4778-a warrior should have a body no spear could penetrate , impervious to wounds , and that blunted iron swords . [Achilles]1161-achilles [himself]1161-achilles and [the Greeks]4756-the greeks were marvelling at it , when [Nestor]1027-nestor said : ‘ [Cycnus]598-cycnus has been [the only one among [[your]8123-your generation]8124-your generation who ignored [swords , and whom no blow could pierce]8125-swords , and whom no blow could pierce]8122-the only one among your generation who ignored swords , and whom no blow could pierce . But , long ago , [I]1027-nestor [myself]1027-nestor saw [one Caeneus of Thessaly , who could take a thousand strokes with unwounded body]8126-one caeneus of thessaly , who could take a thousand strokes with unwounded body : [Thessalian Caeneus]1014-caeneus , [I]1027-nestor say , who , famous for [his]1014-caeneus exploits , lived on [Mount Othrys]935-othrys , and what made it more remarkable in [him]1014-caeneus , [he]1014-caeneus had been born [a woman]1994-a woman . ’[1027-nestor] [All who there were interested by this strange wonder]4780-all who there were interested by this strange wonder , and asked [him]1161-achilles to tell the story . [Achilles]1161-achilles , among [the rest]4436-the rest , said : ‘ Say on , [old one]8128-old one ! [O ancient eloquence]8129-o ancient eloquence , wisdom of [our]8130-our age , all of [us]8130-our equally desire to hear , who [Caeneus]1014-caeneus was , why [he]1014-caeneus was changed to [his]1014-caeneus opposite , what campaign [you]8131-you met [him]1014-caeneus in , fighting against whom , by whom [he]1014-caeneus was overcome , if [anyone]6067-anyone overcame [him]1014-caeneus . ’[1161-achilles] Then [the old warrior]4782-the old warrior said : ‘ Though the slowness of age hampers [me]4782-the old warrior , and many things [I]4782-the old warrior once saw have slipped from [me]4782-the old warrior , [I]4782-the old warrior can still remember many . Nothing sticks more firmly in [my]4782-the old warrior mind than this , amongst all those acts , in battle and at [home]2999-home , and if length of years alone enabled [a man]5897-a man to report many deeds , [I]4782-the old warrior have lived two hundred years : now [I]4782-the old warrior live in [my]4782-the old warrior third century . [[Elatus]1197-elatus ’s daughter]8135-elatus ’s daughter , [Caenis]1198-caenis , [loveliest of [the virgins of [Thessaly]346-thessaly]8137-the virgins of thessaly]8136-loveliest of the virgins of thessaly , was famous for [her]1198-caenis beauty , [a girl longed for in vain , the object of [many suitors throughout [the neighbouring cities]8140-the neighbouring cities and [your]8141-your own]8139-many suitors throughout the neighbouring cities and your own ( since [she]1198-caenis was one of [[your]8141-your people]8142-your people]8138-a girl longed for in vain , the object of many suitors throughout the neighbouring cities and your own ( since she was one of your people , [Achilles]1161-achilles ) . Perhaps [Peleus]974-peleus also would have tried to [we]8143-we d [her]1198-caenis , but [he]974-peleus had already taken [[your]8141-your mother]1807-your mother in marriage , or [she]1198-caenis was promised to [[your]8141-your father]1808-your father . [Caenis]1198-caenis would not agree to any marriage , but ( so rumour has it ) [she]1198-caenis was walking along [a lonely beach]8146-a lonely beach , and [the god]1482-the god took [her]1198-caenis by force . When [Neptune]514-neptune had enjoyed [his]514-neptune new love [he]514-neptune said : “ Make [your]1198-caenis wish , without fear of refusal . Ask for what [you]1198-caenis most want ! ” ( The same rumour mentioned this . ) “ This injury evokes the great desire never to be able to suffer any such again . [Grant]1199-grant [I]4782-the old warrior might not be [a woman]1994-a woman : [you]514-neptune will have given [me]4782-the old warrior everything , ” [Caenis]1198-caenis said . [She]1198-caenis spoke the last words in a deeper tone that might have been the sound of [a man]5897-a man ’s voice . So it was : [the god of [the deep ocean]8151-the deep ocean]8150-the god of the deep ocean had already accepted [her]1198-caenis wish , and had granted , over and above it , that as [a man Caeneus]8152-a man caeneus would be protected from all wounds , and never fall to the sword . [Caeneus]1014-caeneus , [the Atracides]1200-the atracides , left , happy with [his]1014-caeneus gifts , and spent [his]1014-caeneus time in manly pastimes , roaming [the Thessalian fields]8153-the thessalian fields . ’[4782-the old warrior] ‘ [Pirithoüs]1011-pirithoüs , [the daring son of [Ixion]763-ixion]8154-the daring son of ixion , married [Hippodame]1201-hippodame , and invited [the cloud - born centaurs]8155-the cloud - born centaurs to take [their]8155-the cloud - born centaurs place at tables , set in lines , in [a tree - shaded cave]8156-a tree - shaded cave . [Caeneus]1014-caeneus , and [the other Thessalian princes]8157-the other thessalian princes were [there]1878-there , and [I]799-eurytus was [there]1878-there [myself]799-eurytus . [The festive palace]8160-the festive palace echoed with [the noisy crowd]8161-the noisy crowd . See , [they]8161-the noisy crowd were singing the marriage song , and [the great hall]8162-the great hall smoked with fires , and in came [the virgin]1704-the virgin surrounded by [a throng of [young wives]8165-young wives and [mothers]2432-mothers]8164-a throng of young wives and mothers , conspicuous , in [her]1704-the virgin beauty . [We]8167-we declared [Pirithoüs]1011-pirithoüs to be blessed in [[his]1011-pirithoüs bride]6654-his bride , which almost betrayed [his]1011-pirithoüs good fortune . For [your]8169-your heart was heated by the sight of [the girl]1792-the girl as much as by wine , [Eurytus]799-eurytus , [most savage of [the savage Centaurs]8172-the savage centaurs]8171-most savage of the savage centaurs : and drunkenness twinned with lust ruled it . At once the tables were overturned and the banquet in turmoil , and [the new bride]8173-the new bride was grabbed by the hair and dragged off by force . [Eurytus]799-eurytus seized [Hippodame]1201-hippodame : the others whosoever [they]8174-they wished to , or could , and it looked like the rape of [a city]3751-a city . [The palace]6417-the palace sounded with [women]5877-women ’s cries . [We]8178-we all leaped up quickly , and [Theseus]958-theseus , first , shouted out : ‘[799-eurytus] What foolishness drives [you]4783-you to this , [Eurytus]799-eurytus , that [you]4783-you challenge [Pirithoüs]1011-pirithoüs in [my]0-i presence , and unknowingly attack two in one ? Lest [his]0-i words were in vain , [the brave hero]4784-the brave hero pushed aside those threatening [him]0-i , and rescued [the girl]1792-the girl from [the madmen]4786-the madmen . [The other]1689-the other made no reply ( since [he]0-i could not defend [his]0-i actions with words ) but attacked [[her]1689-the other champion]4788-her champion , with violent hands , striking at [his]0-i face and noble chest . There chanced to be an ancient mixing - bowl nearby , embossed with raised designs , and [Theseus]958-theseus raised the huge thing , [he]958-theseus [himself]958-theseus being huger , and threw it straight at [Eurytus]799-eurytus ’s face . [He]958-theseus fell backwards , drumming [his]958-theseus feet on the blood - soaked earth , gouts of blood spurting from mouth and wound equally , along with brain - matter and wine . [[His]958-theseus twin - natured brothers]4789-his twin - natured brothers , taking fire at [his]958-theseus death , emulated [each other]2544-each other , in shouting : ‘ To arms ! To arms ! ’[2544-each other] with a single voice . [Wine]1202-wine gave [them]4789-his twin - natured brothers courage , and , in the first battle , cups , fragile jars , and round basins were sent flying , things intended for feasting , now used for fighting and killing . ’ ‘[1203-amycus] First , [Amycus]1203-amycus , [son of Ophion]4791-son of ophion , did not fear to despoil [the inner shrine of [its]4793-its offerings]4792-the inner shrine of its offerings , and snatched , first , from [the sanctuary]1671-the sanctuary , a chandelier , thickly hung with gleaming lamps , and raising it on high , as one wields a sacrificial axe to break the bull ’s snowy neck , [he]958-theseus dashed it against the forehead of [Celadon]823-mendesian celadon , [the Lapith]4795-the lapith , leaving [him]958-theseus with the bones of [his]958-theseus face crushed past recognition . [His]958-theseus eyes leapt from their sockets , and [his]958-theseus nose , pushed in , as the bones of [his]958-theseus face shattered , was driven into [his]958-theseus palate . At this , [Pelates of Pella]817-pelates , wrenching a leg from a maple - wood table , knocked [Amycus]1203-amycus to the ground , [his]958-theseus chin driven into [his]958-theseus chest : and [[his]958-theseus enemy]6576-his enemy sent [him]958-theseus to [the shadows of [Tartarus]7-tartarus]3250-the shadows of tartarus with a second wound , as [he]958-theseus spat out teeth , mixed with dark blood . Then [Gryneus]1204-gryneus , standing near the smoking altar , gazing at it with wild eyes , shouted : “ Why not put this to use ? ” and lifting the huge altar with its flames , [he]1204-gryneus threw [it]4798-it into the midst of [the crowd of Lapiths]4799-the crowd of lapiths , crushing two of [them]4799-the crowd of lapiths , [Broteas]814-broteas and [Orios]1205-orios : [[Orios]1205-orios ’s mother]4800-orios ’s mother was Mycale , who was often known to draw down the horned moon by [her]4800-orios ’s mother incantations despite its struggles . “ [You]4801-you will not escape with impunity , if [I]0-i can find a weapon . ” said [Exadius]1206-exadius , who found the equivalent of a spear in a stag ’s antlers that hung on a tall pine tree , as a votive offering . [Gryneus]1204-gryneus was pierced in the eyes by the twin branches , and [his]1204-gryneus eyeballs gouged out , one of which stuck to the horn , and the other slipped down onto [his]1204-gryneus beard , and hung there in a clot of blood . Then [Rhoetus]792-rhoetus snatched up a burning brand from the altar , wood from a plum tree , and swinging it down from the right hand side , broke [Charaxus]1207-charaxus ’s temples protected by yellow hair . The hair flared like a dry cornfield , set alight by the quick flames , and the blood seared in the wound gave out a terrible sizzling noise , as a bar of iron is prone to do , when [the smith]4802-the smith takes it , red - hot , from the fire , with curved tongs , and plunges it into a bath of water : it whistles and hisses immersed in the bubbling liquid . [The wounded man]4803-the wounded man shook the rapacious flames from [his]4803-the wounded man shaggy hair , and tearing a stone sill from the ground lifted it on [his]1204-gryneus shoulders , a load for [oxen]7180-oxen , its very weight preventing [him]1204-gryneus from hurling it as far as [[his]1204-gryneus enemy]6576-his enemy : but the mass of stone crushed [[his]1204-gryneus friend]4806-his friend [Cometes]1208-cometes , who was standing nearer . [Rhoetus]792-rhoetus could not contain [his]792-rhoetus delight , saying : “ May [the rest of [the crowd]2430-the crowd on [your]4803-the wounded man side]4807-the rest of the crowd on your side be as formidable as that ! ” and [he]792-rhoetus renewed [his]792-rhoetus attack with the half - burned branch , and with three or four heavy blows broke through the joints of [his]4803-the wounded man skull until the bones sank into the fluid brain . ’ ‘[6480-the victor] [The victor]6480-the victor turned [his]6480-the victor attention to [Euagrus]1209-euagrus , [Corythus]818-corythus and [Dryas]1210-dryas . When [Corythus]818-corythus , one of these , fell , whose first downy hair covered [his]818-corythus cheeks , [Euagrus]1209-euagrus cried : “ What glory is there on [your]4803-the wounded man part in shedding the blood of [a boy]2019-a boy ? ” [Rhoetus]792-rhoetus stopped [him]1209-euagrus from speaking , thrusting the fiery flames into [the man]5875-the man ’s open mouth , and down [his]5875-the man throat . [He]792-rhoetus pursued [you]4812-you , also , savage [Dryas]1210-dryas , whirling the branch round [his]1210-dryas head , but with a different result . As [Rhoetus]792-rhoetus came on exulting in the succession of killings , [you]4812-you ran [him]792-rhoetus through with a charred stake , where neck and shoulder meet . [Rhoetus]792-rhoetus groaned and with an effort wrenched the stake out of the solid bone : then [he]792-rhoetus ran , drenched in [his]792-rhoetus own blood . [Orneus]1211-orneus and [Lycabas]704-lycabas , also ran ; [Medon]709-medon , wounded in the right shoulder ; [Thaumas]1177-thaumas and [Pisenor]1212-pisenor ; and [Mermeros]1213-mermeros who had recently overcome [everyone]2389-everyone by [his]1213-mermeros fleetness of foot , and now ran more slowly from the wound [he]1213-mermeros had suffered . [Pholus]1214-pholus , [Melaneus]670-melaneus , and [Abas]775-abas [the boar - hunter]4814-the boar - hunter also fled , and [Asbolus]661-black - haired asbolus , [the augur , who had vainly tried to dissuade [them]4816-them from fighting]4815-the augur , who had vainly tried to dissuade them from fighting . To [Nessus]1064-nessus , who also ran with [him]792-rhoetus , fearful of being wounded , [he]792-rhoetus said : “ Do not flee ! [You]1064-nessus are fated to be preserved for [Hercules]941-hercules ’s bow . ” But [Eurynomus]1215-eurynomus , and [Lycidas]1216-lycidas , [Areos]1217-areos and [Imbreus]1218-imbreus did not escape death : all these [Dryas]1210-dryas ’s hand killed as [they]4816-them fronted [him]1210-dryas . [You]4817-you also received a wound in front , [Crenaeus]1219-crenaeus , though [you]4817-you had turned [your]4817-you back in flight : as [you]4817-you looked back the heavy blade took [you]4817-you between the eyes , where nose and forehead meet . [Aphidas]1220-aphidas lay amongst the intense noise , without waking , all [his]1220-aphidas strength sunk in endless sleep , still holding a cup of mixed wine , in [his]1220-aphidas limp hand , stretched out on the shaggy skin of a bear from [Mount Ossa]208-mount ossa . [Phorbas]796-phorbas caught sight of [him]1220-aphidas at a distance , uselessly idle in the fight , and fitting [his]796-phorbas fingers into the strap of [his]796-phorbas javelin said : “ Go drink [your]1220-aphidas wine mixed with the waters of [Styx]194-the styx . ” Without hesitating [he]796-phorbas hurled [his]796-phorbas spear at [the youth]1842-the youth , and the ash shaft tipped with iron was driven through [his]796-phorbas neck , as [he]796-phorbas chanced to be lying with [his]796-phorbas head thrown back . [He]796-phorbas did not feel death , and the black blood flowed from [his]796-phorbas welling throat , onto the couch and into the wine - cup itself . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i saw [Petraeus]1221-petraeus trying to tear an oak - tree full of acorns from the ground . While [he]1221-petraeus had [his]1221-petraeus arms round it , bending it this way and that , and shaking the loosened trunk , [Pirithoüs]1011-pirithoüs sent a lance through [his]1221-petraeus ribs , and pinned [his]1221-petraeus writhing body to the hard wood . [They]4819-they say that [Lycus]1222-lycus fell by [Pirithoüs]1011-pirithoüs ’s might , and Chromis by [Pirithoüs]1011-pirithoüs ’s might , but [Dictys]699-dictys and [Helops]1223-helops gave [the victor]6480-the victor a greater title to fame . [Helops]1223-helops was transfixed by a javelin that passed through both temples ; hurled from the right and piercing the left ear . [Dictys]699-dictys , fleeing in desperate panic , pressed hard by [[Ixion]763-ixion ’s son]7479-ixion ’s son , stumbled on [a mountain height]4822-a mountain height , and fell headlong , breaking a huge flowering ash with the weight of [his]796-phorbas body , and entangling [his]1221-petraeus entrails in the shattered tree . [Aphareus]1224-aphareus was there , [[his]1224-aphareus avenger]4823-his avenger , who tried to hurl a rock torn from [the mountainside]6238-the mountainside : but as [he]1221-petraeus tried [Theseus]958-theseus , [the son of [Aegeus]957-aegeus]4825-the son of aegeus , caught [him]1221-petraeus with [his]958-theseus oaken club and broke the massive bones of [his]1221-petraeus elbow . Having neither time nor desire to inflict further injury on [his]1221-petraeus worthless body , [he]1221-petraeus leaped onto tall [Bienor]1225-bienor ’s back , unused to carrying anything but its owner , and , pressing [his]1221-petraeus knees into the centaur ’s flanks , and clutching the mane with [his]1221-petraeus left hand , [he]1221-petraeus shattered the face , the mouth uttering threats , and the solid temples , with [his]1221-petraeus knotted club . With the club [he]1221-petraeus overthrew [Nedymnus]1226-nedymnus , and [Lycopes]1227-lycopes [the javelin - thrower]4826-the javelin - thrower ; [Hippasos]1228-hippasos , [his]1228-hippasos chest protected by a flowing beard , and [Ripheus]1229-ripheus , who towered above the treetops ; [Thereus]1230-thereus , also , who used to take bears on [the mountain slopes of [Thessaly]346-thessaly]4827-the mountain slopes of thessaly , and carry [them]4828-them [home]2999-home angry and alive . [Demoleon]1231-demoleon could no longer stand the success [Theseus]958-theseus was enjoying : [he]958-theseus had been trying , with great effort , to tear up the solid trunk of an ancient pine . Unable to do it , [he]958-theseus broke it off and hurled it at [the enemy]6372-the enemy . But [Theseus]958-theseus drew well away from the oncoming missile , warned by [Pallas]1098-pallas , or so [he]958-theseus would have [us]4831-us believe . The tree trunk did not fall without effect , since it severed [tall Crantor]1232-tall crantor ’s chest and left shoulder from the neck . [He]4832-he was [[[your]4833-your father]1808-your father ’s armour bearer , [Achilles]1161-achilles , whom [[Amyntor]1017-amyntor king of [the Dolopians]4837-the dolopians]4836-amyntor king of the dolopians , having been defeated in battle]4835-your father ’s armour bearer , achilles , whom amyntor king of the dolopians , having been defeated in battle , gave to [Peleus]974-peleus , [the Aeacides]986-the aeacides , as a true pledge of peace . When [Peleus]974-peleus , some distance away , saw [him]958-theseus torn apart by the frightful wound [he]958-theseus shouted : “ Accept this tribute to the dead , at least , [Crantor]1232-tall crantor , [dearest of [youths]6279-youths]4838-dearest of youths , ” and with [his]958-theseus powerful arm , [he]958-theseus hurled [his]958-theseus ash spear , at full strength , at [Demoleon]1231-demoleon . It ruptured the ribcage , and stuck quivering in the bone . [The centaur]3843-the centaur pulled out the shaft minus [its]3843-the centaur head ( [he]3843-the centaur tried with difficulty to reach that also ) but the head was caught in [his]3843-the centaur lung . The pain itself strengthened [his]3843-the centaur will : wounded , [he]3843-the centaur reared up at [[his]3843-the centaur enemy]6576-his enemy and beat [the hero]2234-the hero down with [his]3843-the centaur hooves . [Peleus]974-peleus received the resounding blows on helmet and shield , and defending [his]974-peleus upper arms , and controlling the weapon [he]974-peleus held out , with one blow through the arm [he]974-peleus pierced the bi - formed breast . [Peleus]974-peleus had already , before this , killed [Phlegraeos]1233-phlegraeos and [Hyles]1234-hyles , from a distance , and [Iphinoüs]1235-iphinoüs and [Clanis]822-clanis in close conflict . [He]974-peleus added [Dorylas]819-dorylas to these , who wore a wolfskin cap on [his]819-dorylas head , and instead of a deadly spear , carried a magnificent pair of crooked bull ’s horns , dyed red with copious blood . [I]0-i shouted to [him]819-dorylas ( [my]0-i courage giving [me]0-i strength ) “ See how [your]819-dorylas horns give way before [my]0-i spear ” and [I]0-i threw [my]0-i javelin . Since [he]819-dorylas could not evade it , [he]819-dorylas blocked a wound to [his]819-dorylas forehead with [his]819-dorylas right hand , and [his]819-dorylas hand was pinned to [his]819-dorylas forehead . [He]819-dorylas screamed , but [Peleus]974-peleus ( as [he]974-peleus stood near [him]819-dorylas ) struck [him]819-dorylas with [his]974-peleus sword in mid - stomach , as [he]819-dorylas came to a halt there , overcome by the harsh wound . [Dorylas]819-dorylas leapt forward fiercely , dragging [his]819-dorylas guts on the ground , and as [he]819-dorylas dragged [he]819-dorylas trampled them , and as [he]819-dorylas trampled [he]819-dorylas tore them , entangled [his]819-dorylas legs in them , and fell , with emptied belly . ’ ‘[819-dorylas] Nor did [your]819-dorylas beauty , [Cyllarus]1236-cyllarus , if indeed [we]4843-we attribute beauty to [[your]819-dorylas centaur race]4844-your centaur race , save [you]819-dorylas in the fighting . [His]819-dorylas beard was beginning to show ; a beard the colour of gold ; and a golden mane fell from [his]819-dorylas shoulders half way down [his]819-dorylas flanks . [He]819-dorylas had a liveliness of expression that was pleasing ; [his]819-dorylas neck and shoulders , chest and hands , and all [his]819-dorylas human parts , [you]4845-you would praise as almost sculpted by [an artist]4846-an artist . Nor was the equine part below marred , or inferior to [the human]4847-the human : give [him]819-dorylas a horse ’s head and neck and [he]819-dorylas would be worthy of [a Castor]4848-a castor , the back so fit for [a rider]4849-a rider , the deep chest so muscular . [He]819-dorylas was blacker than pitch all over , except for a white tail , and legs also snow - white . [Many females of [his]819-dorylas race]4850-many females of his race courted [him]819-dorylas , but one , [Hylonome]1237-hylonome , won [him]819-dorylas , none lovelier , among the female centaurs , in [the deep forests]4851-the deep forests . [She]1237-hylonome alone held [Cyllarus]1236-cyllarus ’s affections , by endearments , by loving and admitting love ; and by [her]1237-hylonome appearance , as far as those limbs allow its cultivation : now [she]1237-hylonome would smooth [her]1237-hylonome mane with a comb , now entwine it with rosemary , now violets or roses : or else [she]1237-hylonome wore bright lilies . [She]1237-hylonome bathed [her]1237-hylonome face twice a day in the spring that fell from [the woods]1690-the woods , on [the heights near [Pagasae]347-pagasae]4853-the heights near pagasae , twice dipped [her]1237-hylonome body in [the stream]1788-the stream . [She]1237-hylonome would wear only selected skins of wild beasts that became [her]1237-hylonome , over [her]1237-hylonome shoulder or across [her]1237-hylonome left flank . [Their]4855-they love was equally shared . [They]4855-they wandered [the mountainsides]4856-the mountainsides together , rested at the same time in [caves]1527-caves : and now [they]4855-they had both come to [the palace of [the Lapiths]1238-the lapiths]4858-the palace of the lapiths , and both fought fiercely . A javelin ( who threw it is unknown ) came from the left and took [you]4859-you , [Cyllarus]1236-cyllarus , below the place where the chest swells to the neck . When the weapon was withdrawn the heart , though only slightly pierced , grew cold with the whole body . Immediately [Hylonome]1237-hylonome clasped the dying limbs , sealed the wound with [her]1237-hylonome hand , placed [her]1237-hylonome mouth on [his]4860-his , and tried to prevent the passage of [his]4860-his spirit . Seeing [he]4860-his was dead , with words that the noise prevented from reaching [my]0-i ears , [she]1237-hylonome threw [herself]1237-hylonome onto the spear that had pierced [him]4860-his , embracing [[her]1237-hylonome husband]5872-her husband in dying . ’ ‘[1239-phaeocomes] Still [Phaeocomes]1239-phaeocomes stands before [my]0-i eyes , [he]1239-phaeocomes , who had tied six lion skins together with knotted cords , as a covering , protecting [both man]4862-both man and horse . Hurling a log , that [two teams of oxen]4863-two teams of oxen could hardly move , [he]1239-phaeocomes crushed the skull - bone of [Tectaphos]1240-tectaphos , [son of [Olenus]1241-olenus]4864-son of olenus . The broad dome of [his]1239-phaeocomes head was shattered , and the soft brain matter oozed out through the hollow nostrils , eyes and ears , like curdled milk through the oak lattice , or as liquid trickles through a coarse sieve , under the weight , and squeezes thickly through the close mesh . But even as [Phaecomes]1242-phaecomes prepared to strip the arms from [the fallen man]4865-the fallen man ( [[your]4866-your father]1808-your father knows this ) , [I]0-i thrust [my]0-i sword deep into the despoiler ’s thigh . [Chthonius]1243-chthonius and [Teleboas]1244-teleboas also fell to [my]0-i sword : [the first]4868-the first carried a forked branch , the other a spear : [he]1239-phaeocomes gave [me]0-i a wound with the spear - see , the scar ! - the mark of the old wound is still visible . In those days [I]0-i would have been sent to capture [[Troy]271-troy ’s citadel]4869-troy ’s citadel ; then , [I]0-i could have entertained [Hector]605-jove greatly with [my]0-i weapons , if not overcome [him]605-jove . But [Hector]605-jove at that time was [a child or not yet born]4870-a child or not yet born , now [my]0-i age has weakened [me]0-i . What need to tell [you]4871-you how [Periphas]1246-periphas conquered dual - shaped [Pyraethus]1247-pyraethus ? Why tell of [Ampyx]834-ampyx who drove [his]834-ampyx cornel - wood spear that had lost its tip into the opposing face of four - footed Echeclus ? [Macareus]888-macareus threw a crowbar at the chest of [Pelethronian Erigdupus]1248-pelethronian erigdupus , killing [him]1248-pelethronian erigdupus : and [I]0-i remember how a hunting spear , from the hand of [Nessus]1064-nessus , buried itself in [Cymelus]1249-cymelus ’s groin . Nor would [you]4871-you have thought [Mopsus]1030-mopsus , [[Ampycus]815-ampycus ’s son]4872-ampycus ’s son , only prophesied the future : bi - formed [Hodites]807-hodites fell to [Mopsus]1030-mopsus ’s throw , trying in vain to speak , [his]1030-mopsus tongue fixed to the floor of [his]1030-mopsus mouth , the floor of [his]1030-mopsus mouth to [his]1030-mopsus throat . [Caeneus]1014-caeneus had killed five : [Styphelos]1250-styphelos , [Bromus]1251-bromus , [Antimachus]1252-antimachus , [Elymus]1253-elymus ; and [Pyracmos]1254-pyracmos , who was armed with a battle - axe . [I]0-i do not recall [their]4873-their wounds , but [I]0-i noted [their]4873-their number , and [their]4873-their names . Then [Latreus]1255-latreus rushed forward , massive in body and limbs , armed with the spoils of [Emathian Halesus whom [he]1255-latreus had killed]1256-emathian halesus whom he had killed . [He]1255-latreus was between youth and age , but had the strength of [youth]2370-youth , [his]1255-latreus hair greying on [his]1255-latreus temples . Prancing in a circle , turning to face each of the battle - lines in turn , and conspicuous for [his]1255-latreus Macedonian lance , helmet and shield , [he]1255-latreus clashed [his]1255-latreus weapons , pouring out many proud words , into the empty air . “ Do [I]0-i have to put up with [you]1255-latreus , [Caenis]1198-caenis ? For [you]1255-latreus will always be [a woman]1994-a woman , [Caenis]1198-caenis , to [me]0-i . Does [your]1255-latreus natal origin not remind [you]1255-latreus ; does not the act [you]1255-latreus were rewarded for come to mind , at what cost [you]1255-latreus gained this false aspect of [a man]5897-a man ? Consider what [you]1255-latreus were born as , or what [you]1255-latreus experienced , go , pick up [your]1255-latreus distaff and basket of wool and twist the spun thread with [your]1255-latreus thumb : leave war to [men]5788-men . ” At this [Caeneus]1014-caeneus threw [his]1014-caeneus spear , ploughing a furrow in [the centaur]3843-the centaur ’s side , where [man]6314-man and horse joined , as [he]1014-caeneus was stretched out in the act of galloping . Maddened with pain , [Latreus]1255-latreus struck [the Phylleian youth]4880-the phylleian youth in [his]4880-the phylleian youth unprotected face , with the lance : but it bounced off like a hailstone from [a rooftop]4881-a rooftop , or a small pebble from a hollow drum . Then [he]1255-latreus closed up on [him]4880-the phylleian youth , and tried to thrust [his]1255-latreus sword into [his]1255-latreus impenetrable side : the sword found no way in . [The centaur]3843-the centaur shouted : “ [You]1255-latreus will still not escape ! [I]0-i will kill [you]1255-latreus with the sword ’s edge if the point is blunt . ” Turning [his]1255-latreus blade sideways [he]1255-latreus reached out for [[his]1255-latreus enemy]6576-his enemy ’s loins with [his]1255-latreus long right arm . The blow resounded , as if it struck a body of marble , and the weapon fractured in pieces as it hit the firm flesh . When [he]1255-latreus had exposed [his]1255-latreus unwounded limbs for long enough to [[his]1255-latreus wondering enemy]4884-his wondering enemy , [Caeneus]1014-caeneus said : “ Now let [me]0-i try [your]4884-his wondering enemy body with [my]0-i blade ! ’ and [he]1255-latreus drove [his]1255-latreus fatal weapon into the other ’s side , turning and twisting [his]1255-latreus hand , buried in the guts , causing wound on wound . [See]1257-see , [the centaurs maddened]8179-the centaurs maddened , rushed on [him]1255-latreus with a great shout , and all aimed and threw [their]8179-the centaurs maddened spears at [the one man]6636-the one man . The spears fell , blunted : and [Caeneus]1014-caeneus , [son of Elatus]8181-son of elatus , remained unpierced and unbloodied by all [their]8179-the centaurs maddened efforts . This marvel astonished [them]8179-the centaurs maddened . “ Oh , what overwhelming shame ! ” [Monychus]1258-monychus exclaimed . “ [A people]2237-a people defeated by one who is scarcely [a man]5897-a man : yet [he]6636-the one man is [the man]5875-the man , and [we]8185-we , with [our]8185-we half - hearted attempts are what [he]6636-the one man once was . What use are [our]8185-we huge limbs ? What use [our]8185-we twin powers , and that double nature uniting the strongest living things in [us]8185-we ? [We]8185-we are not [sons of a divine mother]8186-sons of a divine mother : nor of [Ixion]763-ixion who was such as aspired to captivate [great Juno]525-juno : [we]8185-we are overcome by [an enemy]3865-an enemy , who is half [a man]5897-a man ! Roll down rocks and tree trunks on [him]3865-an enemy , and whole mountainsides , and crush that stubborn spirit with [the forests]3338-the forests [we]8185-we hurl ! Let [their]3865-an enemy mass constrict [his]3865-an enemy throat , and let weight work instead of wounds . ” [He]3865-an enemy spoke , and finding a chance tree - trunk toppled by a furious southerly wind , [he]3865-an enemy threw it at [[his]3865-an enemy powerful enemy]8190-his powerful enemy . [He]3865-an enemy served as the example , and in a little while [Mount Othrys]935-othrys was bare of trees , and [Pelion]504-pelion had lost [its]504-pelion shade . Buried under the huge pile , [Caeneus]1014-caeneus strained against the weight of trees , and propped up the mass of oak on [his]1014-caeneus strong shoulders , but as it mounted above [his]1014-caeneus mouth and face , [he]1014-caeneus had no breath of the air that [he]1014-caeneus breathed , and lacking it , often , [he]1014-caeneus tried in vain to raise [himself]1014-caeneus into the air , and throw off the forest piled on [him]1014-caeneus , and often heaved , as if steep [Mount Ida]577-mount ida , that [we]8185-we see there , look , was shaken by an earthquake . [His]1014-caeneus fate is doubtful : [some]3440-some said [his]1014-caeneus body was thrust down to empty [Tartarus]7-tartarus , by [the mass of forest]8192-the mass of forest : but [Mopsus]1030-mopsus , [the son of [Ampycus]815-ampycus]8193-the son of ampycus denied this . [He]1030-mopsus saw a bird with tawny wings fly into the clear air from the midst of the pile , which [I]1014-caeneus saw also , then , for the first and last time ever . As [Mopsus]1030-mopsus watched [him]1014-caeneus smoothly circling [[his]1014-caeneus camp]8194-his camp in flight , making a great noise , [he]1030-mopsus pursued [him]1014-caeneus with mind and vision , saying “ Hail to [you]1014-caeneus , [Caeneus]1014-caeneus , glory of [the race of [Lapiths]1238-the lapiths]8195-the race of lapiths , once [a great hero]8196-a great hero , but now a bird alone ! ” The thing was believed because of its author : grief was added to anger , and [we]8197-we could barely accept [one man]1607-one man being conquered by [so many enemies]8199-so many enemies . Nor did [we]8197-we cease to work off [our]8197-we pain with the sword until half were dead , and half , fleeing , were swallowed by the night . ’[1014-caeneus] As [the hero from [Pylos]270-pylos]4885-the hero from pylos told of this battle between [the Lapiths]1238-the lapiths and [the half - human Centaurs]4886-the half - human centaurs , [Tlepolemus]1259-tlepolemus , [son of [Hercules]941-hercules]4887-son of hercules , [leader of [the Rhodians]4889-the rhodians]4888-leader of the rhodians , could not keep [his]1259-tlepolemus mouth silent in [his]1259-tlepolemus indignation at [Hercules]941-hercules , [the descendant of [Alceus]1062-alceus]4890-the descendant of alceus , being overlooked . [He]1259-tlepolemus said ‘ [Old man]8200-old man , it is amazing that [[your]8200-old man recital]8201-your recital forgot to praise [Hercules]941-hercules : certainly [[my]1259-tlepolemus father]5857-my father often used to tell [me]1259-tlepolemus of [the cloud - born centaurs [he]5857-my father defeated]8203-the cloud - born centaurs he defeated . ’[1259-tlepolemus] [Nestor]1027-nestor answered [him]1259-tlepolemus , sternly . ‘ Why do [you]8200-old man force [me]1027-nestor to remember wrongs , to re - open wounds healed by the years , and to reveal hatred for [[your]8200-old man father]1808-your father and the injuries [he]5857-my father did [me]1027-nestor ? [He]5857-my father has done deeds beyond belief , [the gods]1538-the gods know , and filled [the earth]1463-the earth with [his]5857-my father praises : that , [I]1027-nestor wish [I]1027-nestor could deny . But [we]8207-we do not praise [Deïphobus]1260-deïphobus , or [Polydamas]1261-polydamas , or [Hector]605-jove : who praises [an enemy]3865-an enemy indeed ? [That father of yours]8209-that father of yours razed [[Messene]185-messene ’s walls]8210-messene ’s walls ; destroyed [the innocent cities of [Elis]83-elis and [Pylos]270-pylos]8211-the innocent cities of elis and pylos , and overthrew [[my]1027-nestor household gods]2850-my household gods with fire and sword . [I]1027-nestor say nothing of [the others [he]5857-my father killed]8213-the others he killed : there were [twelve of [us]8207-we]8214-twelve of us , [sons of [Neleus]1262-neleus]8215-sons of neleus , [outstanding young men]8216-outstanding young men , all except [myself]1027-nestor fell to [Hercules]941-hercules ’s strength . [We]8207-we must accept that [the others]1756-the others could be defeated : the death of [Periclymenus]1263-periclymenus was strange , whom [Neptune]514-neptune , [founder of [Neleus]1262-neleus ’s bloodline]8218-founder of neleus ’s bloodline , had granted the power to assume any form [he]514-neptune wished and reverse that which [he]514-neptune had assumed . Now , after [he]514-neptune had changed to every form in turn , [he]514-neptune reverted to the shape of a bird , the eagle that carries the lightning bolts in its curved talons , beloved by [the king of the gods]1581-the king of the gods . [He]514-neptune tore at [the hero]2234-the hero ’s face with all the power of [his]514-neptune wings , [his]514-neptune hooked beak , and crooked claws . Then , as [he]514-neptune soared among the clouds , and hung poised there , [the Tirynthian]8221-the tirynthian fired [his]8221-the tirynthian unerring bow at [him]514-neptune , and pierced [him]514-neptune where the wing meets the side . The wound was not fatal , but the sinews , severed by the wound , failed , devoid of movement or power of flight . [He]514-neptune fell to [earth]1449-earth , [his]514-neptune weakened pinions not mastering the air , and the arrow , clinging lightly to the wing , was driven upwards with the body ’s weight , and forced through the top of the breast into the left side of the throat . Now , [O most glorious leader of [the Rhodian fleet]8224-the rhodian fleet]8223-o most glorious leader of the rhodian fleet , do [you]8223-o most glorious leader of the rhodian fleet think [I]1027-nestor should cry out [your]8223-o most glorious leader of the rhodian fleet [Hercules]941-hercules ’s praises ? Yet [I]1027-nestor look for no other revenge for [[my]1027-nestor brothers]6962-my brothers than to be silent about [his]941-hercules mighty deeds : there is unbroken friendship between [you]8223-o most glorious leader of the rhodian fleet and [me]1027-nestor . ’[1027-nestor] When [Nestor]1027-nestor had told [his]1027-nestor tale in a pleasant voice , passing from [the old man]6107-the old man ’s story to the gifts of [Bacchus]682-bacchus again , [they]4892-they rose from the couches : the rest of the night was given to sleep . But [the god of the trident]4893-the god of the trident , who rules [the ocean waters]4894-the ocean waters , grieved , with [a father]5997-a father ’s feelings , for [the son]4706-the son changed into a swan , the bird of [Phaethon]553-phaethon , and , hating [fierce Achilles]1161-achilles , [he]4706-the son nursed an excessive anger in [his]4706-the son memory . And now , when the war against [Troy]271-troy had lasted for almost ten years , [he]4706-the son called to [Sminthean Apollo]1264-sminthean apollo , the unshorn , in these words : ‘ O , by far [the best loved of [[my]4706-the son brother]6993-my brother ’s sons , who built [the walls of [Troy]271-troy]8228-the walls of troy with [me]4706-the son]8226-the best loved of my brother ’s sons , who built the walls of troy with me , to no purpose , do [you]1264-sminthean apollo sigh at all to see [these battlements]8229-these battlements at the moment of [their]8229-these battlements destruction ? Do [you]1264-sminthean apollo grieve at all that [so many thousands]8230-so many thousands died defending [her]8231-her walls ? Not to name all of [them]8229-these battlements , does not the shade come before [you]1264-sminthean apollo of [Hector]605-jove , dragged round [[his]605-jove own citadel]8232-his own citadel , [Pergama]349-pergama ? But [savage Achilles]1161-achilles , crueller than war itself , is still alive , ravager of [our]8233-our creation . Let [him]1161-achilles be given up to [me]4706-the son . [I]4706-the son would let [him]1161-achilles feel what [I]4706-the son can do with [my]4706-the son three - pronged spear : but since [I]4706-the son am not allowed to meet face to face with [the enemy]6372-the enemy , destroy [him]1161-achilles unexpectedly with a hidden arrow ! ’[4706-the son] [The Delian god]1684-the delian god nodded , and satisfying [his]1684-the delian god own and [[his]1684-the delian god uncle]2445-his uncle ’s desire , [he]1684-the delian god came to the Trojan lines , wrapped in a cloud , and there , among [human massacre]4899-human massacre , [he]1684-the delian god saw [Paris]1187-paris firing infrequent shafts at [unknown Greeks]4900-unknown greeks . Showing [himself]1684-the delian god as [a god]1461-a god , [he]1684-the delian god said : ‘ Why waste [your]1187-paris arrows on the blood of the rank and file ? If [you]1187-paris care for [your]1187-paris own , aim at [Achilles]1161-achilles , [grandson of [Aeacus]972-aeacus]8235-grandson of aeacus , and avenge [[your]1187-paris dead brothers]8236-your dead brothers ! ’[1684-the delian god] [He]1684-the delian god spoke , and , pointing to [Pelides]1265-pelides , who , with [his]1265-pelides weapon , was strewing the ground with Trojan bodies , [he]1684-the delian god turned [Paris]1187-paris ’s bow towards [him]1265-pelides , and guided the unerring shaft with deadly hand . This was the one thing that could delight [old Priam]1181-priam since [Hector]605-jove ’s death . So , [Achilles]1161-achilles , [conqueror of so much greatness]4902-conqueror of so much greatness , [you]1161-achilles are conquered , by [the cowardly thief of [the wife of [a Greek]4905-a greek]4904-the wife of a greek]4903-the cowardly thief of the wife of a greek ! If [your]1161-achilles death had to be by [a woman]1994-a woman ’s hand , in war , [you]1161-achilles would rather have fallen to [an Amazon]4907-an amazon ’s two - edged axe . Now [Achilles]1161-achilles , [grandson of [Aeacus]972-aeacus]8235-grandson of aeacus , [the terror of [the Phrygians]1193-the phrygians]4909-the terror of the phrygians , the glory and defence of the Pelasgian name , [the invincible captain in battle]4910-the invincible captain in battle , was burned : [one god]4911-one god , [Vulcan]568-vulcan , armed [him]1161-achilles , and [that same god]4912-that same god consumed [him]1161-achilles . Now [he]1161-achilles is ash , and little if anything remains of [Achilles]1161-achilles , once so mighty , hardly enough to fill an urn . But [his]1161-achilles fame lives , enough to fill [a world]4913-a world . That equals the measure of [the man]5875-the man , and , in that , [the son of [Peleus]974-peleus]4915-the son of peleus is truly [himself]4915-the son of peleus , and does not know the void of [Tartarus]7-tartarus . So that [you]4916-you might know whose it was , even [his]1161-achilles shield makes war : and arms , for [his]1161-achilles arms , are raised . [Diomede]1073-diomede , [son of [Tydeus]1266-tydeus]4917-son of tydeus , and the lesser [Ajax]605-jove , [[Oileus]1267-oileus ’s son]4918-oileus ’s son , dare not claim [them]4919-them , nor [the younger son of [Atreus]1268-atreus]4920-the younger son of atreus , [Menelaüs]1269-menelaüs , nor the elder , [Agamemnon]1270-agamemnon , greater in warfare , nor the rest . Only [Ajax]605-jove , [the son of [Telamon]973-telamon]4921-the son of telamon , and [Ulysses]1271-ulysses , [Laërtes ’s son]4922-laërtes ’s son , were confident enough for such glory . [Agamemnon]1270-agamemnon , [the descendant of Tantalus]4923-the descendant of tantalus , in order to escape the invidious burden of choosing between [them]4919-them , ordered [the leaders of [the Greeks]4756-the greeks]4924-the leaders of the greeks to meet in [the middle of [the camp]4927-the camp]4926-the middle of the camp , and [he]1270-agamemnon transferred judgement of the dispute to [them]4924-the leaders of the greeks all . When [the captains]4928-the captains were seated , and the rank and file were standing , in a circle , around [them]4928-the captains , [Ajax]605-jove , [master of the seven - layered shield]4929-master of the seven - layered shield , leapt up , and , fired with indignation , [he]605-jove looked back fiercely at [the Sigean shore]4930-the sigean shore , and [the ships]1530-the ships beached on [the shore]2065-the shore , and , pointing to [them]1530-the ships , [he]605-jove said : ‘ It is in front of [these vessels]8237-these vessels [I]605-jove plead [my]605-jove cause , and [Ulysses]1271-ulysses opposes [me]605-jove , by [Jupiter]1158-jupiter ! Yet [he]605-jove did not hesitate to give way before [Hector]605-jove ’s blazing torches , which [I]605-jove resisted , which [I]605-jove drove away from [the boats]8238-the boats . But then , it is less risky to battle using lying words , than to fight with fists , and [I]605-jove am not prompt to speak , as [he]605-jove is not to act . [I]605-jove am as powerful in the fierce conflicts of the battle , as [that man]8239-that man is in talk . [I]605-jove do not think however that [I]605-jove need to mention [my]605-jove deeds to [you]8240-you , [Pelasgians]932-pelasgians , since [you]8240-you have seen [them]8241-them : let [Ulysses]1271-ulysses tell [you]8240-you of [his]1271-ulysses that are conducted without witness , in which night is [the only sharer]8242-the only sharer ! [I]605-jove confess the prize [I]605-jove seek is great : but [[my]605-jove rival]6076-my rival detracts from the honour of it . There is nothing magnificent for [Ajax]605-jove in it , however great the thing is , if [Ulysses]1271-ulysses has aspired to it . [He]1271-ulysses has already won the prize in this contest , since when [he]1271-ulysses is defeated [he]1271-ulysses can say [he]1271-ulysses fought it out with [me]605-jove . As for [me]605-jove , if [my]605-jove courage were in doubt , [my]605-jove noble birth is a powerful argument , [a son of [Telamon]973-telamon]8244-a son of telamon , [he]973-telamon who , under [brave Hercules]941-hercules , captured [the walls of [Troy]271-troy]8228-the walls of troy , and sailed in [the ship]2497-the ship from [Pagasae]347-pagasae , with [the Argonauts]923-the argonauts , to [Colchis]200-colchis . [[Telamon]973-telamon ’s father]8247-telamon ’s father was [Aeacus]972-aeacus , who judges [there]1878-there , among the silent dead , where [Sisyphus]762-sisyphus , [son of [Aeolus]511-aeolus]8249-son of aeolus rolls [his]8249-son of aeolus heavy stone . [Lofty Jupiter]1273-jupiter acknowledges [Aeacus]972-aeacus and confesses [him]972-aeacus to be [[his]1273-jupiter son]1773-his son : so [Ajax]605-jove is third in descent from [Jove]605-jove . Yet even this ancestry would not further [my]605-jove cause , if [I]605-jove did not share it with [great Achilles]1161-achilles . [[Our]8251-our fathers]8252-our fathers , [Peleus]974-peleus and [Aeacus]972-aeacus , were [brothers]1493-brothers : [Achilles]1161-achilles was [[my]605-jove cousin]8254-my cousin , [I]605-jove ask for [[my]605-jove cousin]8254-my cousin ’s weapons ! Why are [you]8256-you , [Ulysses]1271-ulysses , [the son of Sisyphus]8257-the son of sisyphus , and similar to [him]605-jove in [your]8256-you capability for fraud and trickery , involving [an alien race in the affairs of the Aeacidae]8258-an alien race in the affairs of the aeacidae ? Are the arms denied [me]605-jove because [I]605-jove took up arms first , and without being rooted out , and shall [he]605-jove seem [the better man who seized [his]605-jove weapons last , and shirked the fight with a pretence of madness , until [Palamades]1274-palamades , [son of Nauplius]8260-son of nauplius , [the shrewder man]8261-the shrewder man , uncovered [this cowardly spirit]8262-this cowardly spirit ’s deceit , and dragged [him]605-jove to the weapons [he]605-jove shunned]8259-the better man who seized his weapons last , and shirked the fight with a pretence of madness , until palamades , son of nauplius , the shrewder man , uncovered this cowardly spirit ’s deceit , and dragged him to the weapons he shunned ? Shall [he]605-jove own all , who wanted none : shall [I]605-jove , who was the first to put [myself]605-jove at risk , be denied honour , and [[my]605-jove cousin]8254-my cousin ’s gifts ? If only [his]605-jove madness had been real , or been believed , and [this exhorter to crime]8264-this exhorter to crime had never been [[our]8265-our companion against [the Phrygian fortresses]8267-the phrygian fortresses]8266-our companion against the phrygian fortresses ! Then [Lemnos]1275-lemnos would not hold [you]8268-you , to [our]8265-our shame , [Philoctetes]1075-philoctetes , son of [Poeas]1076-poeas , of whom [they]1275-lemnos say that , hidden in [the woodland caves]8269-the woodland caves , [you]8268-you move the stones , now , with [your]8268-you laments , calling down on [[Laërtes]1276-laërtes ’s son]4922-laërtes ’s son the curses that [he]4922-laërtes ’s son deserves , and , if there are [gods]1446-gods , do not curse in vain ! Now , alas , [he]605-jove who was sworn to the same conflict as [ourselves]8265-our , one of [[our]8265-our captains]8272-our captains , heir to [Hercules]941-hercules ’s arrows , weakened by sickness and hunger , clothed and fed by the birds , employs the arrows , that fate intended for [Troy]271-troy , in firing at birds ! Still , [he]605-jove is alive , because [he]605-jove did not accompany [Ulysses]1271-ulysses further : [luckless Palamades]1274-palamades would have preferred to be left behind also : [he]605-jove would have been alive , or at least have died an irreproachable death : [that man there]8273-that man there , remembering all too well the exposure of [his]605-jove own supposed madness , accused [him]605-jove of betraying the Greek cause , and uncovered gold , [he]605-jove had previously hidden , as evidence of the fabricated charge . So , by abandonment or death , [he]605-jove has drawn the strength of [Achaea]350-achaea : that is how [Ulysses]1271-ulysses fights , that is why [he]1271-ulysses is to be feared ! Though [he]605-jove be greater than [Nestor]1027-nestor , the true , in eloquence , [I]605-jove will never believe that [his]605-jove desertion of [Nestor]1027-nestor in battle was anything but a crime . When [Nestor]1027-nestor implored [Ulysses]1271-ulysses ’s help , weary as [he]1027-nestor was with old age , and slowed by a wound to [his]1027-nestor horse , [he]1027-nestor was abandoned by [[his]1027-nestor companion]3554-his companion . [Diomede]1073-diomede , [son of [Tydeus]1266-tydeus]4917-son of tydeus , is well aware that [I]605-jove am not inventing the charge : [he]605-jove called [Ulysses]1271-ulysses repeatedly , by name , and reproached [[his]605-jove cowardly friend]8276-his cowardly friend for running away . [The gods]1538-the gods look down , with the eyes of [the just]1672-the just , at human dealings ! Look , [he]8276-his cowardly friend who gave no help needs it : and as [he]8276-his cowardly friend had abandoned [Nestor]1027-nestor , so [he]8276-his cowardly friend would have been abandoned : [he]8276-his cowardly friend [himself]8276-his cowardly friend had established [his]8276-his cowardly friend own precedent . [He]8276-his cowardly friend shouted to [[his]8276-his cowardly friend companions]2277-his companions . [I]605-jove approached , and saw [him]8276-his cowardly friend , trembling and pale , and shaking with fear of impending death . [I]605-jove thrust out the mass of [my]605-jove shield , and covered [him]8276-his cowardly friend as [he]8276-his cowardly friend lay there , and ( small cause for praise in that ) [I]605-jove saved [his]8276-his cowardly friend cowardly life . If [you]8280-you go through with this contest , let [us]8281-us revisit that spot : revisit [the enemy]6372-the enemy , [your]8280-you wound , and [your]8280-you usual cowardice , hide behind [my]605-jove shield , and contend with [me]605-jove under it ! Yet , after [I]605-jove had snatched [him]8276-his cowardly friend up , [he]8276-his cowardly friend who was granted no strength to stand , because of [his]8276-his cowardly friend wounds , ran for it , not slowed by [his]8276-his cowardly friend wounds at all . [Hector]605-jove approaches , and , with [him]605-jove , leads [the gods]1538-the gods to battle , and [brave men]6203-brave men as well as [you]8280-you are terrified , [Ulysses]1271-ulysses , when [he]605-jove rushes onwards , such is the fear [he]605-jove brings . [I]605-jove felled [him]8276-his cowardly friend to the ground with a huge rock hurled from a distance , as [he]8276-his cowardly friend was exulting in the success of [his]8276-his cowardly friend bloodthirsty slaughter .
